medical_history.chief_complaint: Patient was referred for liver transplantation due to severe liver disease associated with X-linked hyper-IgM syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At three years old, the patient was diagnosed with hyper-IgM syndrome. Abnormal liver-function tests were noted at five years, leading to a liver biopsy at ten years which suggested sclerosing cholangitis. By age eighteen, the patient experienced hematemesis, fatigue, gross ascites, spontaneous bleeding, and intractable pruritus.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hyper-IgM syndrome diagnosed at three years old; history of multiple episodes of hematemesis and requirement for sclerotherapy and banding for esophageal varices.
medical_history.family_history: Younger brother died of Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia, indicating a familial pattern of related health issues.
